# Assignment 3, Problem 1, Part b: Put the output generated by NuSMV for each property below

## b1. EG p
-- specification EG p  is true

## b2. AG (q â†’ AF p)
-- specification AG (q -> AF p)  is false
-- as demonstrated by the following execution sequence
Trace Description: CTL Counterexample
Trace Type: Counterexample
  -> State: 1.1 <-
    state = s0
    p = TRUE
    q = FALSE
    r = FALSE
  -> State: 1.2 <-
    state = s2
    p = FALSE
    q = TRUE
    r = TRUE
  -- Loop starts here
  -> State: 1.3 <-
    state = s3
    q = FALSE
  -> State: 1.4 <-

## b3. EF (AG r)
-- specification EF (AG r)  is true

## b4. A[(p âˆ¨ q) U r]
-- specification A [ (p | q) U r ]   is false
-- as demonstrated by the following execution sequence
Trace Description: CTL Counterexample 
Trace Type: Counterexample
  -- Loop starts here
  -> State: 2.1 <-
    state = s0
    p = TRUE
    q = FALSE
    r = FALSE
  -> State: 2.2 <-
    state = s1
    q = TRUE
  -> State: 2.3 <-
    state = s0
    q = FALSE
